standard_clause: The agreement may be terminated by either party with 30 days' written notice.
Payment shall be made within 45 days of receipt of a valid invoice.
The service provider shall not be liable for indirect or consequential damages.
All confidential information must remain undisclosed for 3 years post-termination.
The intellectual property rights of the developed product shall remain with the client.
The supplier must comply with all data protection and privacy laws.
The client may terminate the agreement if the vendor fails to meet performance standards.
All invoices shall be paid in USD.
Any modification to this agreement must be made in writing.
The service provider will ensure 99.9% uptime for hosted services.
The parties shall not disclose confidential information to third parties.
The agreement is governed by the laws of England and Wales.
The customer shall indemnify the supplier against all claims arising from misuse.
Either party may terminate this agreement with cause upon 10 days' written notice.
The service provider shall carry adequate insurance coverage at all times.
Data shall not be transferred outside the EEA without written consent.
The vendor shall deliver all milestones by the agreed delivery date.
The employee shall not compete with the company for a period of 12 months post-termination.
Late payments shall attract an interest of 1.5% per month.
The agreement shall automatically renew for successive one-year terms.
The client acknowledges that minor delays shall not constitute a breach.
The parties agree to resolve disputes amicably before arbitration.
The vendor shall maintain proper records of all services rendered.
Any breach of confidentiality will lead to immediate termination.
The service provider must comply with applicable labor laws.
This agreement supersedes all prior communications between the parties.
The supplier shall provide software updates quarterly.
The contractor shall ensure compliance with anti-bribery legislation.
The buyer shall inspect goods upon delivery.
The company may revise fees with 30 days’ written notice.
Neither party shall be liable for delays due to force majeure events.
The vendor shall ensure employees undergo regular security training.
The client will provide all necessary resources for project completion.
The service provider must obtain prior consent before subcontracting.
The supplier guarantees that products are free from defects for one year.
The vendor shall promptly report any data breach to the client.
The client agrees not to hire or solicit vendor employees for 12 months.
The supplier will deliver reports in PDF format monthly.
The agreement will terminate automatically upon insolvency of either party.
The software shall be compatible with industry standards.
The company reserves the right to audit vendor performance annually.
The parties agree to electronic execution of this contract.
The vendor is responsible for ensuring compliance with GDPR.
Any disputes shall be referred to arbitration in New York.
The service provider shall maintain data backups daily.
The client agrees to pay additional fees for expedited delivery.
The contractor shall comply with environmental regulations.
The agreement may be extended upon mutual written consent.
The vendor shall immediately notify the client of any potential risks.
The supplier shall notify the buyer of shipment within 24 hours.
All employees must sign a confidentiality agreement before commencing work.
The company shall have ownership of all inventions created under this contract.
The contractor must maintain industry certifications throughout the contract period.
The client shall not reproduce or distribute the licensed software.
The provider may suspend service for non-payment after 15 days.
All deliverables must meet the specifications outlined in Schedule A.
The supplier is responsible for transportation and insurance until delivery.
The customer acknowledges receipt of all goods in satisfactory condition.
The company may terminate this agreement immediately for breach.
The developer shall not reuse proprietary code in other projects.
The vendor must obtain prior approval for using third-party materials.
All disputes shall be governed by the laws of California.
The customer shall ensure premises are accessible for installation.
The contractor must provide weekly progress updates.
The company shall provide 14 days' notice before price adjustments.
The service provider must delete client data after project completion.
The supplier agrees to replace defective products within 7 days.
All marketing materials must be approved by the client.
The contractor must comply with all occupational safety regulations.
The agreement shall not create a partnership or joint venture.
The provider shall notify the client before any system downtime.
The client shall bear the cost of additional change requests.
The supplier must maintain stock levels sufficient to meet demand.
The service provider shall retain records for five years.
The contractor shall not assign this contract without prior consent.
The agreement becomes effective upon signature by both parties.
The company reserves the right to withhold payment for non-performance.
The client is responsible for providing accurate data inputs.
The supplier must immediately report any regulatory violations.
The vendor shall implement encryption for all data in transit.
The customer shall test and approve deliverables within 10 business days.
The contractor must not disclose the client’s name without consent.
The provider shall ensure regular maintenance of supplied equipment.
All employees must complete annual cybersecurity training.
The client shall reimburse travel expenses upon submission of receipts.
The company must provide necessary documentation within the agreed timeframe.
The vendor shall ensure that subcontractors comply with all obligations.
The supplier must retain proof of quality checks for audit purposes.
Either party may extend this agreement upon mutual consent.
The contractor is responsible for any penalties due to late delivery.
The provider shall maintain an incident response plan.
The client may request modification of services upon 10 days’ notice.
The software license is non-transferable and limited to one user.
The vendor shall ensure accessibility compliance under WCAG 2.1.
The agreement shall remain confidential between the signing parties.
The supplier must notify the client before engaging new subcontractors.
The provider shall ensure system logs are retained for audit purposes.
The agreement shall be valid for a period of 24 months from execution.
The contractor shall provide warranty support for six months post-delivery.
